Job Title:
Sr Analyst, Global Analytic Insights
Job Description
Your Journey at Concentrix Starts Here:
At Concentrix our mission is to be the greatest customer engagement services company in the world, rich in diversity and talent. We believe in doing right by and for people, our clients, their customers, our staff, our communities, and our planet.
We cannot achieve this vision without you!
If you have an interest in improving our performance for the world’s best brands in over 70 countries spanning 6 continents, please continue reading. There are a few characteristics we look for across all our hires regardless of the team they are working for. If this is you, we would love to discuss career opportunities with you.
 Are you ready to reimagine the world?
 Does working for a company who invests in the future and is inspiring in the marketplace intrigue you?
 Are you bold in your decisions, and do you have contrarian views on how to run a business?
Concentrix provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in many benefit programs, generally including private medical plans, great compensation package, retirement savings plans, paid learning days, and flexible workplaces. Specific benefits plans will vary by country/region.
In our Information Technology and Global Security team, you will deliver the latest technology infrastructure, transformative software solutions and industry-leading global security for our staff and clients. You will work with the best in the world to design, implement and strategize IT, security, application development, innovation, and solutions in today’s hyperconnected world. You will be part of the technology team that is core to our vision of develop, build and run the future of CX.
We’re a remote-first company looking for the absolute best talent in the world.
The Contact Center Performance Business Analyst will deliver analysis of contact center performance and customer satisfaction data to support operational improvement initiatives. You will work on an analytic team to assess processes that have an impact on customer satisfaction scores or other key metrics and on the design and implementation of initiatives to improve those scores. The Business Analyst will interpret performance trends, identify root causes behind the trends, and then contribute to the development of performance improvement efforts. You will report to Global Analytics Manager
Responsibilities:
Review customer satisfaction and other operational metric results on a daily/weekly/monthly basis to identify trends in performance; produce monthly management reports.
Analyze qualitative and quantitative data and identify performance improvement opportunities via Microsoft Pivot tables, crosstabs or via other tools. Determine areas for drill-down focus and conduct analyses to understand the drivers of performance gaps. 
Develop key driver analysis, statistical linkages and calibration between metrics.
Coordinate data feeds with Operations to provide data for analysis.
Document current operational processes as part of root cause analysis and input to improvement initiatives; identify possible gaps that may contribute to lower key metric results.
Facilitate root cause analysis to determine the underlying drivers behind performance gaps. Root cause may include on site observation, interviews, and process documentation.
Contribute to analytic/engagement plan development based on analytic findings, metric performance, and client our needs.
Contribute to recommendation/initiative development based on results of analysis.
Develop updates to reflect current status of activities; monitors progress against action plans; monitor contact center operational performance on objectives; isolate initiative effectiveness on improving key performance metrics.
Produce documentation of key insights, solution recommendations, solution business cases and action plan results for incorporation into internal or client reviews.
Contribute to team goals.
Produce quality analysis or root cause; meet timing demands. 
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in related field from a four-year college or university with three to five years related experience. MBA a plus
Desired advanced MS skills; Experience in R, Python
Ability to organize and prioritize projects in a fast paced and deadline-oriented business development
Experience with statistical concept and applications, data analysis
Analytics background
Plan, and take actions through engagement, prioritization, and foresight
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills; ability to apply quantitative data analysis techniques to improve work processes.
Strong organizational and project management skills.
Able to establish a course of action for self to accomplish a series of specific goals while using appropriate resources.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Experience with contact centers, customer satisfaction data analysis
Experience with statistical concepts and applications
Experience working in an environment where work activities and deliverables are dependent on a diverse group of technical and business functional experts.
Experience working in an emerging environment.
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines.
Experience with process consulting a plus.
Six Sigma certification a plus.
Must have proficiency with multiple software applications including email messaging application, Microsoft Word, Excel (including Pivot table / Power Pivot functionality) and PowerPoint.
Location:
COL Bogata - Plaza Titan
Language Requirements:
Time Type:
Full time

Launchpad, a people-first technology company, is a leader in North America´s rapidly growing tech sector. Through two solutions, Launchpad supports its clients with digital transformation:
PaasportTM, our iPaaS solution, streamlines software integration and automates workflows. 
Nearshore Staff Augmentation, our managed IT staffing service, connects top IT talent across various geographical regions, bringing industry expertise to leading clients. 
Based in Vancouver, Canada, our operational footprint spans across North and South America, with a second headquarters in Santiago, Chile.
In 2023, our unwavering dedication to innovation garnered recognition as a Deloitte Technology Fast 50™ Program Company. Our clientele boasts industry leaders such as Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.
At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then we’d love to hear from you.
Are you a skilled Business Intelligence Developer eager to explore new opportunities? We want to introduce you to our Business Intelligence Developer talent pool. While we may not have an immediate opening, we are building a selected pool of professionals for upcoming projects. At Launchpad, we value innovation and expertise. By being part of our Talent Pool, you're positioning yourself for exciting opportunities in the future.
Why join our Talent Pool?
Stay ahead: By becoming a part of our Talent Pool, you'll be first in line for consideration when a suitable role opens up. 
Showcase your expertise: Share your skills, projects, and experience with us, so we can match you with the right role. 
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data and reporting requirements. 
Design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms. 
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources to create comprehensive datasets. 
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data retrieval and transformation. 
Create interactive and visually compelling reports and dashboards. 
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency. 
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with data and reports. 
Stay updated on emerging business intelligence technologies and best practices. 
Participate in the planning and execution of business intelligence projects. 
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. 
Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Developer or in a similar role. 
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes. 
Proficiency in business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, QlikView). 
Advanced SQL skills for data querying and manipulation. 
Experience with data visualization best practices and design principles. 
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. 
Ability to communicate complex data concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Preferred Skills:
Familiarity with data governance and data quality principles. 
Knowledge of data integration tools and methodologies. 
Experience with cloud-based business intelligence solutions. 
Understanding of business processes and key performance indicators (KPIs). 
Familiarity with scripting languages for data manipulation (e.g., Python, R). 
Why work for Launchpad?
100% remote
People first culture
Excellent compensation in US Dollars
Hardware setup for working from home
Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia
Training allowances
Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc. 
...and more!
At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.
Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

Sabemos que los grandes resultados sólo se consiguen con un gran equipo, por eso buscamos personas con talento y pasión, con ganas de crecer profesionalmente, y crear una trayectoria profesional con nosotros.
Estamos en búsqueda de un Ingeniero de Datos Senior para unirse a nuestro equipo y desempeñar un papel clave en el proyecto de Diseño e Implementación de la Arquitectura de Datos, en particular, el Lago de Datos. El candidato ideal debe poseer amplia experiencia en procesamiento y análisis de grandes volúmenes de información de datos, habilidades en herramientas ETL, bases de datos, y un conocimiento sólido de lenguajes de programación, especialmente Python. Además, es deseable que tenga experiencia en tecnologías como Databricks, Delta Lake, calidad de datos y DataOps, así como certificaciones en el manejo de datos en nubes de Azure, AWS o Google Cloud.
Responsabilidades
Colaborar en la implementación de la arquitectura de datos y el lago de datos.
Desarrollar y mantener procesos ETL eficientes para la adquisición y transformación de datos.
Asegurar la calidad de los datos y la integridad del lago de datos.
Trabajar en la optimización del rendimiento y la escalabilidad de la infraestructura de datos.
Participar en proyectos de analítica de datos, procesamiento de grandes volúmenes de información y análisis de datos estructurados y no estructurados.
Contribuir a la implementación de prácticas de DataOps para una gestión eficiente de datos.
Colaborar con otros miembros del equipo técnico en la utilización de datos para la toma de decisiones.
Mantenerse actualizado en las mejores prácticas y tendencias emergentes en el campo de la ingeniería de datos.
Requisitos Esenciales
Título profesional en ingeniería de sistemas, ingeniería electrónica, ingeniería de computación, ingeniería industrial o áreas afines.
Posgrado en ingeniería, analítica de datos, ciencia de datos, ciencias de la computación, ingeniería de datos, gestión de información o disciplinas relacionadas.
Mínimo de siete (7) años de experiencia profesional.
Experiencia específica de al menos cinco (5) años trabajando en proyectos de analítica de datos o procesamiento de grandes volúmenes de información de datos estructurados y no estructurados.
Competencia en lenguajes de programación, especialmente Python.
Habilidades en herramientas ETL y bases de datos.
Experiencia en tecnologías como Databricks, Delta Lake, calidad de datos y DataOps.
Certificaciones en el manejo de datos en nubes de Azure, AWS o Google Cloud.
Vivir en Bogotá y tener disponibilidad para trabajo hibrido

The Data Developer role revolves around crafting comprehensive technological solutions that cover the entire data lifecycle. They specialize in tasks such as data ingestion, transformation, governance, organization, and provisioning, ensuring efficient and secure data management.
Requirements
Responsibilities:
Design and implement robust data pipelines to collect and ingest data from diverse sources
Develop and maintain ETL (Extraction, Transformation, and Loading) systems to uphold data integrity and quality standards
Contribute to defining and implementing scalable and resilient data architectures
Continuously optimize and enhance the performance of data systems
Collaborate with the team to uphold best software development practices across the data lifecycle
Stay abreast of emerging trends in data technologies, tools, and methodologies
Requirements:
Substantial experience in similar initiatives
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Familiarity with DBT (ETL tool)
Advanced English proficiency for business communication
For Tech Lead/Master roles: Experience in deploying and monitoring data pipelines, along with a track record in people development
Nice-to-haves:
Experience with Bedros and Travis
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure
Experience in implementing DataOps practices
Proficiency with Tableau and/or PowerBI
Benefits
Comprehensive health and dental coverage
Meal allowances
Childcare assistance
Extended parental leave
Gympass membership
Annual profit-sharing distribution
Life insurance coverage
Access to an online mental health platform
CI&T University training resources
Discount Club benefits
Support Program covering legal, financial, physiotherapy, psychological guidance, nutritionist consultations, and more
Pregnancy course and responsible parenthood support
Partnerships with leading online course platforms
Platform for language learning and skill enhancement
Annual Salary Range:
 R$60,000 to R$100,000.

Brief Description
IDENTIFICACIÓN DEL CARGO
Cargo:
 Consulting Analyst
Dependencia:
 Consultoría
Programa (si aplica):
 Microsoft
Reporta a:
 Sr Consultant o Consulting Manager
Supervisa a (posiciones):
 no tiene personas a cargo
OBJETIVO GENERAL DEL CARGO 
Participar en los todos los aspectos de los proyectos de consultoría, desarrollando las habilidades y competencias necesarias para iniciar el plan de carrera de un consultor.
PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILIDADES
1.1 Apoyar en las diferentes actividades de ejecución de proyectos de consultoría de operaciones;
1.2. Participar en las actividades internas del equipo del proyecto, de acuerdo al rol asignado por el Gerente del proyecto
1.3. Elaborar cronogramas de trabajo y hacer seguimiento permanente a los mismos, garantizando la oportuna ejecución de las actividades y el cumplimiento de los compromisos con los clientes;
1.4. Facilitar la participación activa de los responsables y colaboradores de los proyectos;
1.5. Interactuar con los clientes, estableciendo relaciones 1 a 1 que faciliten la ejecución de los proyectos;
1.6. Organizar y participar en las entrevistas y reuniones de trabajo, documentar, sintetizar y analizar los resultados de las mismas;
1.7. Asistir en la recopilación y análisis de información mediante el uso de herramientas tecnológicas establecidas por el cliente y por los Gerentes de Proyecto;
1.8. Apoyar en la preparación y presentación de informes de avance, paneles de información, documentos y demás entregables que estén dentro del alcance del proyecto;
1.9. Apoyar en las labores administrativas inherentes al área de consultoría de operaciones y a los proyectos en los que se participa;
1.10. Trabajar con los Gerentes de Proyecto de Nextant para garantizar el adecuado desarrollo de los proyectos y la documentación interna necesaria para el control del área de consultoría;
1.11. Participar activamente en la ejecución del Sistema de Gestión en Seguridad y Salud en el Trabajo, dedicando el tiempo necesario para las actividades que el empleador le asigne y participando en los deberes como empleado.
COMPETENCIAS 
 
Construcción de relaciones (ALTO)
Trabajar con el propósito de establecer y mantener de forma amigable, profesional y estratégica relaciones cordiales que posibiliten la consecución de metas. Identifica con facilidad los contactos clave de la organización que posteriormente pueden incidir favorablemente en la consecución de metas 
Trabajo en equipo (ALTO)
Habilidad para lograr metas en común, poniendo en juego las competencias complementarias de los diferentes integrantes de grupo. Implica colaborar con los demás y ser responsable por las acciones propias, midiendo el impacto que generan las mismas en el logro de los objetivos comunes. 
Sociabilidad/Relaciones Interpersonales (ALTO)
Capacidad para mezclarse fácilmente con otras personas y establecer con ellas relaciones altamente satisfactorias a nivel personal, social y laboral.?Implica establecer y mantener relaciones armónicas, afectivas, honestas y efectivas para el logro de los proyectos. 
Orientación al cliente (interno y externo) (ALTO)
Es la disposición para realizar el trabajo con base en el conocimiento de las necesidades y expectativas de los clientes (personas internas o externas a la organización). Implica preocuparse por entender las necesidades de los clientes y dar solución a sus problemas; así como realizar esfuerzos adicionales con el fin de exceder sus expectativas. 
Habilidades de comunicación (oral y escrita) (ALTO)
Capacidad de transmitir en forma efectiva, ya sea oral o escrita, la información que es de relevancia para el interlocutor, adaptándose a las cualidades del receptor. Implica la habilidad de escuchar al otro para identificar sus requerimientos/inquietudes y responder eficientemente a ellos. 
Pensamiento Analítico (ALTO)
Es la capacidad de entender una situación, desagregándola en pequeñas partes o identificando sus implicaciones paso a paso. Incluye organizar las partes de un problema o situación de forma sistemática, al realizar comparaciones entre diferentes elementos o aspectos y establecer prioridades de una forma racional. 
Resolución de Problemas (ALTO)
Capacidad de encontrar las verdaderas causas y soluciones de una situación o problema específico, cuyos resultados son sustentados con un alto nivel de eficacia y confiabilidad. 
Capacidad de síntesis de conceptos complejos (MEDIO)
Es la capacidad de reconocer y describir los elementos constitutivos de una realidad y proceder a organizar la información significativa según criterios preestablecidos adecuados a un propósito. 
Gestión y manejo de los recursos (MEDIO)
Identificar, ubicar, organizar, controlar y utilizar en forma racional y eficiente los recursos disponibles, en la realización de proyectos y actividades. 
Orientación al detalle (MEDIO)
Es la capacidad de y viveza sensorial. Actitud constante dirigida a observar un proceso, objetivo o idea para percibirlo en toda su magnitud, diferenciando rápidamente detalles y variaciones. Se relaciona con la minuciosidad de análisis y manejo de conjuntos complejos y amplios de información de cualquier tipo con la que la persona ha de trabajar, procurando eliminar el error y las duplicidades, etc. 
FORMACIÓN ACADÉMICA
Profesional en áreas de Ingeniería Industrial, Administración de Empresas o carreras afines.
EXPERIENCIA LABORAL 
No requiere experiencia previa.
Preferible que haya desarrollado práctica empresarial, ConsultAndes o algún programa similar durante la carrera.
IDIOMAS
Dominio del idioma inglés al 100% (escritura, lectura y oral).
Otras Características y Conocimientos 
Afinidad con la industria de tecnología 
Visa americana vigente y disponibilidad para viajar 
Manejo de los programas Microsoft Office y en particular dominio de PowerPoint

About The Position
Company Overview
Our client is a leading company specialized in AI and machine learning. They focus on data annotation and training datasets to accelerate AI development. With a platform that combines human intelligence and technology, they serve various industries, including autonomous vehicles and robotics, contributing to the advancement of AI technology.
About The Job
We are seeking Code QAs (
not a QA role
, though) for an opportunity with a US-based company in the AI space. You will play a crucial role in training generative artificial intelligence models, fostering their development into skilled coders and contributing to the creation of advanced coding tools for the next generation.
It’s a remote position, and 
we are open to full and part-time commitments.
If you are currently employed, we would advise you to start part-time, so you can test the waters and see if you like the job!
The main responsibilities of this role are:
Assessing the quality of AI-generated code, providing clear and human-readable summaries of your reasoning. 
Resolving coding problems by crafting functional and efficient code solutions. 
Developing robust test cases to validate the efficiency and effectiveness of the code. 
Ok, but what will I do?
Review AI-generated code, focusing on solving the problem like only human devs can do. You will be basically solving coding challenges.
Requirements
Main requirements
We are currently looking for engineers with strong python skills
Advanced English
No AI experience is required
At least 20 hours available per week to work (you can make your schedule, but it's important to have this availability)
You must live in Latin America!
Hiring Process
Revelo Hackerrank timed test. It's a 45-min test, to assess your problem-solving and algorithm skills
What's in there for me?
Freelance opportunity: you can have an extra income with time flexibility 
Remote work
Flexibility
Possibility to work more hours (and be paid for that) if you want to. 
Understand a bit more about the AI universe
How am I going to be paid?
You are going to be paid for the time you dedicated to solving the tasks, hourly. The payment will happen monthly. 
You would be an independent contractor. 
Possibility to have access to bonuses (based on performance)
You are going to be paid for the time you dedicated to solving the tasks, hourly. The payment will happen weekly (except for the first 2 weeks / the first 2 weeks will be paid on the 3rd week). 
FAQ 
Do they offer any benefits? Like vacations, health insurance, etc?No. This is a freelance opportunity, based on projects. 
Can I work on weekends to reach the minimum of 20 hours, or to make extra hours? Yes. Totally up to you. 
I'm living in another country, can I work on this project? If the country is within Latin America, yes.

Group/Division: QEL/QRM
Location: Remote
Are you a problem solver who loves challenges and enjoys creativity? We have an exciting opportunity for a Master Data Analyst on our Quality Analytics & Reporting team within Quality Risk Management. We need someone who is driven to deliver results and has strong and proactive communication skills. As an analytics expert, you will not only facilitate delivery of insights to multiple businesses but will take an active role in identification of root causes to prevent and eliminate recurring issues. As a Master Data Analyst, you will lead projects to design and create complex reports and dashboards, and analyze data using advanced statistical analysis tools and techniques. You will direct and mentor junior staff to develop, validate, and deliver high-quality analytics to enhance the quality of our clinical trials. Don't miss this opportunity to join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where we are seeking to improve our customers' experience while driving technology solutions to solve the world's scientific problems!
A strong candidate for this role will be highly analytical and process oriented, with a consistent record to find opportunities, tackle problems, develop, and implement project plans. You will also have a confirmed history of working efficiently and transparently across functional teams.
What will you do?
Collaborate with Quality business partners to understand and support their analytical needs and deliver useful insights to relevant decision-makers.
Design, develop & enhance global reports and dashboards. Build and maintain innovative interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.
Statistically analyze data to answer key questions from business partners or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.
Ensure data accuracy by directing & managing end-user tool validation activities. Directs data audits of critical fields in various tools, databases, & dashboard.
Prioritize requests for delivery of reports, data, and dashboards and coordinate activities of other personnel. Independently identify methods and procedures on new assignments. Review completed work before sending to customer.
Work with data architecture teams to design datasets and data pipelines necessary to support development of analytics and reporting.
Take ownership for achieving results within the specified time period and provides regular updates to leadership.
Implements standard processes & practices in support of various systems and tools.
Advise leadership regarding development and/or optimization of function-specific metrics, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Serve as a subject matter authority for data analytics and analysis and mentor junior team members. Proactively identifies & actions training opportunities for staff.
Work on sophisticated issues where analysis of situations or data requires in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Bachelor’s degree preferred in a scientific and/or quantitative field.
Advanced skills in software used in business intelligence (such as Excel, Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau).
12+ years of practical experience in applying statistical analysis to data using software (such as Minitab, SAS).
5+ years of structured problem-solving use with a proven track record of finding ways to improve processes.
Conversationally proficient in data science. Basic knowledge of SQL preferred.
An ability to clearly explain data insights to teams and provide options for next steps.
Project management skills with demonstrated ability to take initiative, supervise and handle own deadlines, drive projects to completion
Good communication skills and the ability to influence senior leadership, along with all levels of the organization
Strong organizational skills with solid attention to detail for production of high quality work.
Demonstrated proficiency in office productivity applications (such as Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Visio and Excel)
Excellent customer service skills with a focus on understanding customer requirements.
Ability to effectively manage multiple assignments with challenging timelines.
Ability to lead team meetings, communications and process flows within departmental structure and across functional groups.
English language proficiency (verbal and written).
High ethical standards to support a professional business code of conduct.
Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

At Kin + Carta, we’ve got opportunities to offer you — for growth, for leadership, for big, world-changing impact and for, dare we say it, fun. We are a global workforce that is committed to building a world that works better for everyone. And that starts with our Kin. That’s why we’re proud of:
The life we create within our virtual walls, every day
Our B Corp certification
Our ranking in Consulting Magazine's 2022 “Best Large Firms to Work For”
The work we’ve done
The role
Ideal candidates will have strong quantitative backgrounds and analytical discipline. While they will have some demonstrated ability to write code, they will not have learned programming languages for the sake of building their resume, but rather as a means to express their intellectual curiosity and analytical voice. Kin + Carta will provide a platform and training to help them reach their full potential.
Kin + Carta
 is looking to hire a 
BI Data Analyst/Engineer
 to join our growing capabilities team. If you are innovative, passionate about data and AI technologies, and look to continually learn and enjoy sharing expertise, read on!
Role Responsibilities
Analyze a collection of raw data sets to create meaningful impact to large enterprise clients while maintaining a high degree of scientific rigor and discipline.
Engineer simple data pipelines (aggregation and simple business logic) and products to help stakeholders make and execute data driven decisions.
Communicate analytical findings in an intuitive and visually compelling way.
Creating highly visual and interactive dashboards via Tableau, PowerBI, or custom web applications
Conducting deep dive analysis and designing KPIs to help guide business decisions and measure success
Building and tracking project timelines, dependences, and risks
Gathering stakeholder requirements and conducting technical due diligence toward designing pragmatic data-driven business solutions
Minimum Qualifications
We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.
Proven industry experience executing BI, analytics and/or data visualization projects or Bachelors/Masters degree in quantitative studies including Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or computation-intensive Sciences and Humanities.
Proficiency (can execute data ingestion to insight) in programmatic languages such as SQL, Python, and R. 
More than 4 years of experience working in similar roles. 
Experience with visualization/reporting tools like Tableau and programmatic visualization library such as R ggplot2, Python matplotlib/seaborn/bokeh, Javascript D3.
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in visualization/reporting tools such as Tableau and PowerBI or programmatic visualization library such as R ggplot2, Python matplotlib/seaborn/bokeh, Javascript D3.
Proficiency in big data environments and tools such as Spark, Hive, Impala, Pig, etc. 
Proficiency with cloud architecture components (AWS, Azure, Google)
Experience with data pipeline software such as Airflow, Luigi, or Prefect
Ability to turn raw data and ambiguous business questions into distilled findings and recommendations for action
Experience with statistical and machine learning libraries along with the ability to apply them appropriately to business problems
Proficiency in front and back-end web application development stacks and frameworks (Javascript, HTML, CSS, React/Vue/AngularJS) including API design (REST/GraphQL) and library development 
Experience leading and managing technical data/analytics/machine learning project
About Kin + Carta
Kin + Carta is a global digital transformation consultancy committed to working alongside our clients to build a world that works better #ForEveryone. We build digital solutions that connect people, data and technology for some of the world’s most influential companies. As a Certified B Corp, we are committed to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Awareness, and our triple bottom line focus of people, the planet and profit.
We strive to create an inclusive environment for all candidates. If you have any specific requirements or need reasonable adjustments to participate in the application or interview process, please let us know at amer.ta.team@kinandcarta.com.

job_title: Sr Analyst Pharmaco Vigilance & Medical Information
job_description:
About Knight
Knight Therapeutics es una compañía farmacéutica panamericana (ex estadounidense) especializada enfocada en adquirir, otorgar licencias, otorgar licencias, comercializar y comercializar productos farmacéuticos recetados innovadores en Canadá y América Latina. Knight es propietario de Biotoscana Investments S.A.. Las acciones de Knight Therapeutics cotizan en TSX con el símbolo GUD. Knight, con sede en Montreal, cuenta con más de 700 empleados en todo el mundo.
Position Summary
Ejecutar las actividades de Farmacovigilancia e Información Médica en la región asignada. El Analista Regional Senior trabaja en estrecha colaboración con los otros departamentos de Knight (médico, marketing, acceso, etc.).
Rol & Responsabilidades 
Las actividades del analista regional Senior de FV incluyen:
• Procesar informes de seguridad de casos individuales (ICSRs, de sus siglas en inglés) de todas las fuentes en conformidad con las regulaciones aplicables, los procedimientos de Knight y los requisitos y plazos de los socios licenciantes. Codificar el ICSR según MedDRA. Proteger datos personales. Realizar actividades de seguimiento y reconciliación de ICSR.
• Adaptar y revisar los informes de seguridad periódicos y/o anuales y someterlos a las Autoridades Sanitarias según la normativa aplicable.
• Adecuar y revisar Planes de Gestión de Riesgos y someterlos a las Autoridades Sanitarias según la normativa aplicable. Una vez aprobado, implementar y dar seguimiento a las actividades adicionales (como distribución de materiales a profesionales de la salud, recopilación de datos).
• Capacitar a los empleados/subcontratistas de Knight sobre las responsabilidades de informar reacciones adversas al momento de la incorporación y anualmente.
• Servir de enlace eficiente con proveedores externos de programas de farmacovigilancia y apoyo al paciente, según corresponda.
• Brindar apoyo sobre los requisitos de FV a otros departamentos % DE TIEMPO 100 Formulario Título: Descripción de puesto FOR-00493 [1] 3 de 3 de Knight (por ejemplo, médico, marketing, acceso, etc.).
• Abrir y controlar desvíos y CAPAs relacionados con actividades de FV/IM. Las actividades de Información Médica del analista regional incluyen:
• Realizar todas las actividades de información médica regional dentro de la base de datos de Información Médica.
• Dar apoyo en convenciones/congresos científicos clave a través de la participación en la preparación de la reunión o la participación posterior al congreso con equipos multifuncionales, así como dotando de personal a los puestos de información médica durante los congresos.
Las actividades adicionales de Información Médica y FV incluyen:
•Desarrollar procedimientos operativos estándar (POEs) locales de información Médica y FV y procesos de instructivo de trabajo. Mantener el cumplimiento con los requisitos de capacitación regionales sobre POEs e instructivos de trabajo.
•Brindar asesoramiento para la actualización del etiquetado de seguridad de los productos. •Facilitar el desarrollo y mantenimiento de documentos y/o soporte de presentación para mejorar el acceso.
•Participar en proyectos/iniciativas locales y/o regionales según sea necesario
Educación 
Químico farmacéutico. Inglés intermedio
 
Experiencia
2 años en farmaco vigilancia, idealmente trabajando para varios paises de Latino América

job_title: ETL Engineer - Remote Work - Medellin, Colombia
job_description:
At BairesDev®, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.
Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.
When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.
ETL Engineer at BairesDev
We are looking for ETL Engineers to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, and team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest-growing companies in the industry!
These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, and get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.
What You Will Do
 Design and develop (enhancements and maintenance) new ETL Solutions.
 Improve slow-running jobs with the help of redesign and better ETL processes to meet business needs.
 Support the team to design, model, develop, and maintain existing and new SQL database objects required for all business solutions.
Here Is What We Are Looking For
 5+ years of experience in ETL Solutions development and expertise in designing and implementing Relational Database models per business needs.
 Experience in Database Development, Design, Analysis, Support in Development, Testing, and Production Environments with various business domains.
 Python experience is a big plus.
 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent is highly desirable.
 Advanced English level.
How We Make Your Work (and Your Life) Easier
100% remote work (from anywhere).
Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred
Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.
Supportive environment with mentorship, promotions, skill development, and diverse growth opportunities.
Join a global team where your unique talents can truly thrive!

At
 Intellias
, we're always on the lookout for exceptional talent to join our team in Colombia. Over 20 years of market experience, Intellias brings together technologists, creators and innovators in Europe, North and Latin America, and the Middle East. Join our international team and take the mission to solve the advanced tech challenges of tomorrow!
If you're enthusiastic about contributing your skills and experience to our organization, we invite you to submit your CV for this position.
Requirements:
SQL
 queries and database management.
Experience with 
Looker (or similar Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
 for data visualization and dashboard creation.
Strong skills in data pipeline creation using tools like 
DBT
 (Data Build Tool).
Expertise in data validation techniques and ensuring data quality.
Experience with GCP or other Cloud Platform
You will contibute to:
Dashboard Maintenance and Monitoring:
Maintain, instrument, and monitor the Component Reliability dashboard.
Enable engineering teams to utilize the dashboard to understand the reliability and usage of each component.
Facilitate the creation of Pareto charts and help teams understand which components and errors require further investigation.
KPI Tracking and Reporting:
Maintain and monitor the Reliability Topline KPIs dashboard.
Provide insights to Engineering STOs, PMTs, and MLI Leaders on progress towards KPIs.
Identify top contributing pipelines, error categories, and owners impacting Time to Fail.
Service Reliability and Operational Support:
Track and report SEV SLA KPIs through the SEV Tracker dashboard.
Provide visibility through observability dashboards
Instrument new Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and maintain and monitor alerts.
Maintaine dashboards and instrument new reliability metrics.
What we offer you in Colombia
Indefinite 
contract with Intellias Colombia SAS
Payment in COP
Health, life, funerary and pet insurance for the employee
Extra vacation days
Workation up to 90 day outside Colombia
Training and certifications
100% work from home + internet subsidy
100% English environment

Elevate Your Impact Through Innovation and Learning
Evalueserve is a global leader in delivering innovative and sustainable solutions to a diverse range of clients, including over 30% of Fortune 500 companies.
With presence in more than 45 countries across five continents, we excel in leveraging state-of-the-art technology, artificial intelligence, and unparalleled subject matter expertise to elevate our clients' business impact and strategic decision-making.
We have 4,500+ talented professionals operating across 45 countries, including India, China, Chile, Romania, the US, and Canada. Our global network also extends to emerging markets such as Colombia, the Middle East, and the rest of Asia-Pacific.
Recognized by Great Place to Work® in India, Chile, Romania, the US, and the UK in 2022, we offer a dynamic, growth-oriented, and open culture that prioritizes flexible work-life balance, diverse and inclusive teams, and equal opportunities for all.
Curious to know what it’s like to work at Evalueserve?
About Data Analytics (DA)
Data Analytics is one of the highest growth practices within Evalueserve, providing you rewarding career opportunities. Established in 2014, the global DA team extends beyond 1000+ (and growing) data science professionals across data engineering, business intelligence, digital marketing, advanced analytics, technology, and product engineering. Our more tenured teammates, some of whom have been with Evalueserve since it started more than 20 years ago, have enjoyed leadership opportunities in different regions of the world across our seven business lines.
What you will be doing at Evalueserve
Designing customized solutions for our clients that condense industry-specific KPIs into data products.
Leading BI development projects and self-managing your workload.
Performing data wrangling activities, including querying, cleaning, transforming, and loading large chunks of data originating from multiple sources.
Creating new data models that feed into BI solutions.
Ensuring data integrity and data quality through the life cycle of projects.
Performing analysis and generating descriptive to prescriptive insights on collected data.
Developing reports and dashboards that tell visual data stories.
Communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders to gather business requirements, identifying bottlenecks, defining priorities, developing solutions, and communicating results.
Keeping your technical and domain expertise sharp and continually developing your soft skills by participating in company-sponsored programs and self-development activities.
Being a team player, collaborating to advance the Business Analytics practice at Evalueserve through participation in internal initiatives including workshops and the development of product accelerators.
What we're looking for
3+ years of experience in BI development.
Experience working with Google Looker.
Experience working with multiple BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio).
Data Analysis using SQL plus either Python or R.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Advanced verbal and written communication skills in English
Strong attention to detail.
Knowledge of Cloud Infrastructure like Azure is a plus.
Experience with CI/CD tools, Git is a plus.

Company Description
Join GfK and help us shape tomorrow. As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View™ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.
We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.
Job Description
Next time you go shopping, think about this: What if brands asked for your opinion on their products before they put them on the shelf? Wouldn't that be nice? At 
Netquest
 we give voice to the consumers enabling them to shape the products and services of tomorrow. How? We deliver consumers' genuine opinions and data to help companies create better products for you.
We're now looking for a 
Senior Data Engineer 
to join our Data Team. We have to cover the three main specialties at the data field: Data Science, Data Analytics and Data Engineering. Today we have covered all the current needs in each field but we are looking for a boost in the Data Engineering part, looking to the future, by adding a person who provides us experience and knowledge about doing things in the right direction.
Currently we are working on developing a solid data strategy inside 
Netquest
, so we are looking for a team builder, someone who enjoys working with others and working with different people and departments, understanding their needs, sharing the decisions with the team and explaining the data solutions to the partners.
As a 
Senior Data Engineer 
you will have the following key accountabilities:
The senior data engineer will look beyond their primary team scope and work toward harmonization and improvement of solutions across the CSG or even beyond
The senior data engineer is also accountable for passing on their knowledge to other engineers when the opportunity arises during the course of their work: during pair programming/pair work, when sought for advice, and during code reviews
By participating in Communities of Practice
The senior data engineer brings together technical assets from different disciplines within their team and encourages a common solution approach between team members with different technical backgrounds
You will report to the Head of Data
Qualifications
Now that we've introduced you to the position as 
Senior Data Engineer 
what skill, qualifications and experience should you have?
The ability to design and implement an entire data pipeline from scratch
Solve with scale-out approaches and how to combine them in data pipelines
Knowledge about Data Architecture
Awareness of Data Governance
An economic view on questions of operability of crafted data pipelines:
Maintain data integrity in cases of reprocessing
Understanding of whether or how (internal or external) customer data deliveries are affected by changes to the software
Awareness of data design patterns in the organization and best practices in general
3+ years of experience with data modelling, data schemas and evolution thereof
Awareness of best practices of data transformation design patterns
An advanced focus on data integrity when creating data pipelines, by building in means to monitor data health and state of intermediate data and alerting mechanisms
Design Quality Control/Validation processes / Quality Gates
Technologies and standards:
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Awareness of scheduling tools, like Apache Airflow
Interest in Big Data solutions, like Apache Spark
In depth understanding of the Data Engineering techniques
Maintain and extend processes and functionalities
Experience with application packaging and delivery mechanisms, including CD/CI best practices and security concerns
The ability to integrate partial solutions and RnD results into production-ready data pipelines
The ability to build and operate infrastructure (e.g, for testing purposes)
The ability to support on operational questions for environments in production
Understanding of cloud infrastructure and services available for setting up and maintaining data pipelines (e.g., AWS)
Advise on data transformation workflow designs and optimizations with the dimensions of cost, performance and delivery mechanisms (streams / increments / etc.)
Additional Information
Why 
Netquest
 is great for you? We offer the following benefits:
Prepaid Medicine paid 100% by the company (MedPlus)
Birthday Day Off
40 hours per week
Hybrid work - 2 days at office, 3 days at home
Unlimited Employee Asistance Program (EAP) 
Our Benefits
Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)
About NIQ
NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
For more information, visit NIQ.com
Want to keep up with our latest updates?
Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Who We Are:
We are a tech-enabled growth firm–at the intersection of marketing, consulting & data intelligence–igniting revenue and brand recognition for leading and emerging companies around the world. As a people-first firm, we value diversity in backgrounds and experiences. We strongly believe our people and culture are key to our success. Our vision is to be recognized as the most valued and respected private growth marketing firm in the world–with a scalable brand, culture and services.
As a full-service growth marketing firm, we offer best-in-class services including: SEO, Content Marketing, Paid Media, Social Media Marketing, Programmatic + CTV, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing, Email + SMS, Conversion Rate Optimization, Retail Marketing, Creative, and Web Development. Here at Power Digital, we are hyper-focused on helping brands drive revenue growth and brand recognition, ultimately driving irrefutable value for our clients.
At the heart of Power Digital is our proprietary technology, nova, which analyzes businesses through first-party data, simplifying investment planning for marketing and diligence in M&A––putting marketers in a strategic seat at the table––and providing value in unparalleled ways.
Managing billions in media, our dynamic team––of consultative marketers, creatives, analysts and technologists––challenge traditional ways of planning and measurement through meticulous testing and data science across each milestone of the customer journey.
Proficiency in spoken and written English at an advanced level is required for this role.
This is a contract position with the intent to hire as a full-time employee in 30-90 days after start date.
A day in the life:
This position requires a deep understanding of Salesforce functionalities, including Sales Cloud and Service Cloud, as well as proficiency in custom development using Apex, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. You will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and debugging innovative Salesforce solutions that translate complex business requirements into effective, user-friendly applications and processes.
Responsibilities:
Develop and customize Salesforce applications using Apex, Lightning Components, and Visualforce pages to meet evolving business needs.
Ensure robust integration of Salesforce with other systems and platforms, utilizing APIs and middleware tools to streamline operations and enhance data flow.
Maintain high standards of data management and security within Salesforce, applying best practices to safeguard information and enhance system performance.
Collaborate closely with business analysts and project managers to understand and deliver on business requirements while providing technical insights and solutions.
Participate actively in development cycles, including planning, coding, testing, and deployment, using agile methodologies to deliver high-quality software solutions.
Role Requirements:
Salesforce CRM Knowledge: Understanding the functionalities and capabilities of the Salesforce platform is essential. This includes knowledge of Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and other Salesforce products.
Programming Experience: Having experience in programming languages such as Apex (Salesforce's proprietary language), JavaScript, HTML, and CSS is highly valuable. Apex is particularly important as it is the backend language for Salesforce.
Development of Lightning Components: Knowing how to develop and work with Lightning Components, which are user interface elements on the Salesforce Lightning platform.
Visualforce Pages: Although used less frequently due to Lightning, knowledge of Visualforce is still useful, as many organizations still have Visualforce pages in use.
Database and SOQL Knowledge: Understanding database concepts and being able to use Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) to retrieve data from the Salesforce database.
Data Management and Security: Understanding how to manage data within Salesforce and how to apply security and privacy settings.
Integrations: Knowing how to integrate Salesforce with other applications and services, which may include the use of APIs and middleware tools.
Experienced with Figma and/or Zeplin
Experienced in upholding established development processes (e.g. code reviews, style guides, pattern libraries)
Experienced and proficient in source control (gitlab / Github)
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Development Cycle Time: Measure the time from initial code write to deployment for new features, aiming to reduce cycle time by 5% annually to increase development agility.
Code Quality and Stability: Maintain a bug discovery rate of less than 2% of new code deployments. Achieve a 80% pass rate on first-run code reviews, emphasizing high-quality, maintainable code.
Salesforce Integration Success Rate: Successfully integrate Salesforce with at least two new external systems or platforms annually, with a 95% uptime. Measure the stability and performance of integrations, aiming for less than 1% integration-related issues.
Salesforce Feature Utilization: Develop and deploy a set number of new Salesforce Lightning components or Visualforce pages each quarter, with a utilization rate by end-users of over 68% within the first month of release.
Data Management Efficiency: Improve data retrieval times by optimizing SOQL queries, aiming for a 8% improvement in response times year over year. Ensure 100% compliance with data security standards, with zero breaches of security incidents related to improper data handling.
Most Important Things (MITs)
Code Quality and Efficiency: Focus on writing clean, efficient, and reusable code that aligns with established development standards and best practices.
Understanding Business and User Needs: Thoroughly understand the business requirements and user needs to ensure that the front-end interfaces and Salesforce functionalities effectively address them.
Continuous Learning and Salesforce Expertise: Continually enhance Salesforce skills, including staying updated with the latest Salesforce releases and features. Engage in paid training and achieve at least one new Salesforce certification annually.
Collaboration and Communication: Maintain effective communication with team members and stakeholders to ensure clear understanding and alignment on project goals. Regularly participate in code reviews and collaborative sessions to foster a team-oriented environment.
Security and Data Management: Adhere strictly to data security and privacy settings within Salesforce to ensure that all data handling is compliant with regulatory standards and company policies.
Power Digital's people and culture are at the core of our success, which is why diversity in our team's backgrounds and experiences are paramount. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences, and backgrounds, who strive to make an impact inside and outside of the workplace. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of one's identity. All of our employees' points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.
Please be aware of fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers from suspicious sources. Long Description
Imagina trabajar en una empresa que realmente se preocupa por sus colaboradores, clientes, partes interesadas y toda la comunidad involucrada. ¡Imagínate trabajar para una empresa que se compromete con hacer lo correcto y que tiene como objetivo ser el mejor proveedor de seguros del mundo!
Zurich es una de las principales compañías de seguros del mundo y una de las pocas que opera a escala global. Con alrededor de 55.000 empleados, dedicados a comprender las necesidades de nuestros clientes y ofrecer soluciones para particulares y empresas, desde pequeñas empresas hasta multinacionales.
Aquí, apostamos por la Sostenibilidad, innovando en las políticas de desarrollo y uniéndonos cada vez más con los cambios del mundo. Nos preocupamos por la confianza en la sociedad y en la forma en que estamos constantemente innovando, buscando tecnología y estrategias que nos permitan brindar una experiencia memorable a nuestro cliente.
También fomentamos una cultura de diversidad e inclusión. Nuestra declaración de propósito y valores está diseñada para proteger, inspirar confianza y ayudar a nuestros colaboradores a alcanzar su máximo potencial.
¡Ven a ser un Zuricher y forma parte de nuestro equipo como
 Analista pólizas colectivas de automóviles!
Responsabilidades:
 Dar soporte en el área de expedición de pólizas colectivas de automóviles
 Realizar movimientos sobre pólizas colectivas de autos según solicitud del cliente o intermediario
 Cumplir con ANS de respuesta tanto al cliente interno como al cliente externo
Habilidades y experiencia:
 Formación: Técnico Profesional en Administración de seguros, administrativas o afines.
 Experiencia mínima de 2 años en aseguradoras en roles similares.
 Idioma: inglés (Deseable)
 Excel intermedio y manejo de bases de datos.
 Atención al detalle, organización y comunicación asertiva.
Si has llegado hasta aquí, ¡gracias por leernos! Si sientes que encajas con nosotros y te entusiasma la oportunidad, no dudes en ponerte en contacto y aplicar.
Esperamos conocerte pronto.

El Support Engineer tiene la misión de garantizar el cumplimiento de nivel de servicio (SLAs) comprometido con los clientes, dando solución oportuna a los requerimientos e incidencias para todos nuestros proyectos en Latam. Son responsables de dar el primer y segundo nivel de soporte frente a necesidades de configuración y solución de problemas técnicos que requieran de atención inmediata, canalizando solicitudes hacia niveles superiores de soporte de acuerdo a los protocolos internos definidos. Asimismo, son responsables de hacer pruebas y laboratorios replicando situaciones de problemas o troubleshooting a nivel de servidores y networking, de modo que nos podamos anticipar a problemas y sus soluciones.
Whitestack despliega Cloud privados en diversas capitales latinoamericanas. En cada uno de estos sites, hay decenas o cientos de servidores, interconectados con networking de alta velocidad, y soportando aplicaciones de misión crítica (como el tráfico de Voz de un operador de telefonía móvil), lo que requiere una disponibilidad cercana al 99.999%.
Por esta razón estamos buscando a los mejores ingenieros de DevOps para su área de Cloud SupportSite Reliability, puestos de gran relevancia para garantizar la continuidad de la operación de grandes centros de datos, los que soportan las aplicaciones e infraestructura de telecomunicaciones críticas e ininterrumpidas que desplegamos.
Responsabilidades:
Brindar soporte técnico de Nivel 1 para las plataformas y servicios productivos. 
Gestión de incidencias de acuerdo a los protocolos establecidos y realizando el escalamiento que corresponda. 
Prestar comunicación eficiente y efectiva al cliente. 
Documentación de los soportes realizados, tanto en tickets como en las plataformas dispuestas. 
Gestionar actividades que sea necesario ejecutar sobre ambientes de producción, coordinando las actividades, tanto de manera interna como con cliente, para su debida intervención.
Generar laboratorios de pruebas y troubleshooting a nivel de servidores y networking. 
Disponibilidad para realizar tareas de soporte fuera de horario hábil, en actividades programadas con clientes, de mantenimiento, despliegues, u otras. 
Disponibilidad para participar de sistema de turnos on call para soporte N1.
Los requisitos profesionales que debes tener:
Autonomía (para lograr los mejores resultados)
Adherencia a estándares de clase mundial
Apertura de aprender nuevas tecnologías
Orientación al objetivo
Pensamiento analítico
Trabajo en equipo (para coordinar con equipos de desarrollo y despliegue de productos)
Disponibilidad para trabajar en turnos, rotatorios, según legislación de cada país.
Los requisitos técnicos con los que debes contar:
Experiencia:
Al menos 2 años de experiencia como Ingeniero de Soporte Cloud o SRE. 
Experiencia trabajando con tecnologías afines. 
Formación: 
Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas, Ingeniería Electrónica, o afín. 
Conocimientos Específicos / Requisitos Técnicos: 
Linux avanzado
Virtualización en OpenStack
Orquestación de contenedores en Kubernetes
Sistemas productivos de misión crítica
Automatización vía Linux Bash, Ansible y/o Python.
Inglés intermedio (para leer/escribir documentación técnica)
¡Un plus! Si llegas a tener experiencia/certificación:
Técnicos
Conocimientos del modelo de operación de una red Fija o Móvil.
Experiencia técnica en:
Integración de proyectos de código abierto
Arquitectura de software
Networking (BGP, OSPF, EVP-VXLAN, etc)
Certificaciones en Linux,OpenStack 
Certificación administrador de Kubernetes
Cursos en ansible y bash scripting
En Whitestack somos líderes en el desarrollo de soluciones Telco Cloud y Open Networking, llevando su implementación a grandes proyectos de operadores en América Latina, aprovechando proyectos de código abierto (como OpenStack, Kubernetes, Open Source Mano, Ceph, Prometheus y muchos otros), en colaboración con organizaciones globales como la ETSI, la fundación Open Infrastructure, el Telecom Infra Project, el Open Compute Project y otras.
Si quieres saber sobre algunos de nuestros beneficios, puedes dar click aquí: Working at Whitestack

-based website development and maintenance, along with expertise in implementing plugins, Google APIs, event tracking codes, and microdata markup on webpages.

. We are a dynamic, fast-paced, and integrated digital inbound marketing agency. Best suited for motivated self-starters, we specialize in B2B services and technology marketing.

WHO YOU ARE:

Full-Time (40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, 9 am to 5:30 pm EST)
100% Remote

Desarrollamos una suite de soluciones cloud basada en IA que eleva la experiencia digital de alumnos, docentes y staff de las universidades, habilitando modelos educativos disruptivos, optimizando recursos y automatizando tareas.
Foris es una empresa EdTech 
bootstrapped
 que ha crecido sostenidamente los últimos 8 años y busca desarrollar tecnología de impacto. Hoy nuestros productos alcanzan un millón de estudiantes en 10 países de LatAm y España.
Los retos que tenemos por delante desafían y nos emocionan. Estamos diseñando nuestros sistemas para 
gran escala
. Llegaremos a nuevos países y pronto cruzaremos las fronteras del mundo hispanohablante.
Aprende más sobre nuestro camino, cultura y lo que hacemos en nuestro perfil.
 ¿Qué desarrollador buscamos?
En Foris, buscamos 
desarrolladores proactivos, amantes del los desafíos y del trabajo en equipo.
 Serás parte del ciclo completo de producto, desde el diseño hasta el desarrollo, deployment y mantenimiento, y trabajarás con los equipos de Frontend y Producto para llevar nuestra plataforma al siguiente nivel.
Esperamos que te apasione la idea de trabajar en un producto y construir soluciones de largo plazo. Cada línea de código que aportes será parte de una solución para miles usuarios que tú y tu equipo continuarán perfeccionando en el futuro.
Dado el rol que asumirás tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades:
Desarrollar, mantener y mejorar sistemas backend escalables y eficientes.
Colaborar estrechamente con el equipo de desarrollo para diseñar e implementar soluciones técnicas.
Participar en la identificación y resolución de problemas técnicos.
Optimizar y mejorar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones existentes.
Investigar y aplicar buenas prácticas de desarrollo y patrones de diseño.
Colaborar en la documentación técnica.
 Lo que necesitarás para sumarte a nuestro equipo
Tienes un nivel junior en desarrollo Back-end:
Tomamos como referencia los lineamientos de GetOnBoard (https://www.getonbrd.com/help/seniorities-policy)
Tienes una base teórica sólida en los fundamentos de la ingeniería de software. En particular:
Cómo funciona el ciclo de desarrollo de sistemas
Patrones de arquitectura como MVC o Cliente-Servidor
Paradigmas de programación como POO y Programación funcional
Tienes un dominio básico de algún lenguaje de desarrollo Back-end:
De preferencia alguno de estos lenguajes: PHP, Python y/o JavaScript
Tienes un dominio básico de bases de datos relacionales. En particular:
Modelamiento de bases de datos
Motores de base de datos tales como: Mysql, PostgreSQL
Conoces de procedimientos almacenados, vistas, funciones
Habilidades clave
Participas en la identificación y resolución de problemas técnicos, demostrando una capacidad excepcional para el diagnóstico de errores y proponer mejoras.
Tienes buenas prácticas de proyectos de código colaborativo:
Escribes código para que otros lo lean y lo entiendan.
Sabes documentar tu código y tus diseños de solución.
Tienes buenas prácticas de trabajo en equipo:
Expresas tus pensamientos con precisión.
Te comunicas con transparencia y honestidad.
Respetas distintos puntos de vista y los integras en tus soluciones.
Inglés: Te sientes cómodo/a leyendo artículos técnicos en inglés y escribiendo código en inglés. Mejor aún si puedes consumir contenido técnico audiovisual en inglés.
 Además, esperamos que estés muy interesado/a en aprender o profundizar
Soluciones cloud de AWS para despliegue de aplicaciones web, principalmente DBs en RDS y Buckets en S3.
Kubernetes.
Sistemas de control de versiones (por ejemplo, Git).
Desarrollo de APIs RESTful y/o GraphQL.
Jira en la planificación y gestión de tus actividades.
 Por último, te contamos de Foris y el equipo en que trabajarás
Somos un equipo multidisciplinario, motivado, amante de la tecnología y con ganas de generar impacto. Nuestro ambiente es multicultural, tenemos una proporción 40-60% entre mujeres y hombres, tanto en el equipo DEV como en todo Foris, y pertenecemos a distintas nacionalidades como Chile, Colombia, Alemania, Perú, Francia y contando!
Sabemos que no todo es trabajo: nos encanta reunirnos, presencial o virtual, para celebrar hitos importantes y conocernos mejor como equipo.

¡Únete a nuestro equipo! Periferia IT Group, multinacional colombiana líder del sector de TI con presencia en Ecuador, Panamá, Perú, México y Estados Unidos; con más de 900 profesionales caracterizados por la pasión y la calidad, entregando experiencias inigualables a más de 120 clientes en diferentes países, busca profesionales con compartan nuestra pasión por la tecnología y que deseen unirse a nuestro equipo. Si tu expertise es en Desarrollo Strearling
;
 y quieres marcar la diferencia en el mundo digital, ¡esta es tu oportunidad! 💼💻
¿Qué te ofrecemos?
🚀 
Desarrollar tu potencial
: Brindamos un entorno de trabajo que fomenta tu crecimiento profesional y personal. Te apoyamos en cada paso de tu carrera, ofreciéndote oportunidades de capacitación y desarrollo continuo. 📚📈
💡 
Trabajar en proyectos desafiantes impactando positivamente
: Colaborarás en proyectos emocionantes y de vanguardia, donde podrás aplicar tus habilidades y conocimientos técnicos para resolver problemas complejos, contribuyendo al éxito de nuestros clientes. 🌟🌍💪
🤝 
Equilibrio de vida – trabajo
: Enfocamos nuestros esfuerzos en alcanzar objetivos superiores brindando experiencias memorables a nuestros genios y clientes, por esto alentamos a nuestros equipos a mantener un balance adecuado entre su vida personal y laboral, apoyados en un plan de beneficios enfocado en salario emocional. 👨🏻‍💻👩🏼‍💻✨
👥 
Cultura de servicio
: Somos profesionales con gran talento y pasión por lo que hacemos. Fomentamos un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y centrado en el cliente, donde el intercambio de ideas y el trabajo en equipo son fundamentales para alcanzar resultados excepcionales superando las expectativas. 🌍🤝
¿Qué esperamos de ti?
Profesional en Ingeniería de Sistemas, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones, Ingeniería Electrónica, Ingeniería Telemática, Ingeniería Industrial o afines.
Experiencia de 3 años en Desarrollo IBM Strearling
¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Remoto - Colombia
Contrato a término indefinido
Salario a convenir
Plan de beneficios

About The Position
About nok
Nok is the full-service re-commerce system powering the circular economy at scale. Nok helps brands & retailers, including Dyson, Logitech, Therabody, Wyze, and T3, repurpose returns and maximize revenue recovery. We are committed to powering the circular economy. Nok is backed by seasoned entrepreneurs and institutional investors like Greycroft, Village Global, Moonshots Capital, Tech Square Ventures, and eGateway.
We are fresh off a funding round and growing quickly.
Key Responsibilities
Advocate for improvements to tooling and testing practices that have an impact across your team. 
Empower product engineers to own their code quality
Automate difficult, and repetitive testing scenarios
Perform both automated and manual testing in line with internal standards, and best practices. Maintain and advocate for these standards throughout the SDLC
Partner with product engineers and product managers to deliver high-impact features Preferred Skills & Qualifications
Experience performing both manual and automated testing
Experience with BDD/TDD, automated cross-browser testing, and load testing
BONUS: experience at an organization transitioning from manual testing to automated testing
BONUS: Experience with AWS and/or E Commerce
Requirements
None
Benefits
Vacaciones / Flexibilidad de Trabajo
Trabajo Remoto: Globalmente remoto

Job Posting: Training and Career Opportunity with Graduation Bonus
Are you ready to advance your career with an exciting training opportunity that comes with a graduation bonus and a job offer? Join our team and start with a comprehensive training program designed to set you up for success.
Training Program Details:
- *Duration:* 2-8 weeks
- *Schedule:* Typically 4 hours per day, 5 days a week,
- *Content:* Intensive bootcamp-style training covering essential skills and knowledge required for the role.
*Graduation Bonus and Job Offer:*
- *Bonus:* Successful graduates will receive a $1,200,000 bonus upon completion of the training.
- *Job Offer:* Graduates will receive a job offer with a salary range based on their experience.
- *Contract:* The job offer includes an indefinite contract, providing long-term employment security.
The ideal candidate will help build, maintain, and troubleshoot, the company's rapidly expanding infrastructure. They will work alongside other engineers to ensure highest levels of performance and ability, and manage any problems that arise. 
 
Responsibilities
Manage and monitor installed systems
Test and maintain operation systems
Monitor application performance
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
Experience in configuring, monitoring and troubleshooting systems
Strong scripting and technical skills

Rol:
Desarrollador PL/SQL
Requisitos:
Profesional en Ingeniería de Sistemas e Informática, Administración de Sistemas, Técnico en Sistemas, Tecnólogo en Sistemas o Tecnólogo en Telecomunicaciones.
Al menos 6 años de experiencia como desarrollador en PL/SQL.
Dominio de técnicas de tunning de SQL utilizando parallel execution y bulk collect para procesar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Habilidades blandas 
Capacidad de análisis.
Creatividad.
Innovación.
Trabajo en equipo.
Planificación.
Responsabilidad.
Compromiso.
Liderazgo.
Habilidades de comunicación tanto oral como escrita.
Organizado
Metódico
Proactivo
Deseable:
 Conocimiento en la herramienta OpenCard o Bankbú.
 
Número de Vacantes:
 1
 
Funciones:
Desarrollar procedimientos almacenados, funciones y desencadenadores en PL/SQL para Oracle Database.
Optimizar consultas y mejorar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones mediante técnicas de PL/SQL.
Poseer un conocimiento sólido de la sintaxis y características avanzadas de PL/SQL, incluyendo cursores, manejo de excepciones y tipos de datos compuestos.
Diseñar esquemas de bases de datos y realizar modelado relacional.
Utilizar herramientas de desarrollo de Oracle como SQL Developer o PL/SQL Developer.
Escribir consultas complejas y realizar análisis de datos utilizando PL/SQL.
Asegurar la seguridad de las bases de datos y gestionar los privilegios de usuario en Oracle.
Colaborar con otros miembros del equipo de desarrollo y seguir estándares de codificación establecidos.
Mantener y actualizar sistemas existentes que utilicen PL/SQL.
Resolver problemas relacionados con la base de datos y la lógica de negocio implementada en PL/SQL.
Mantenerse actualizado con las últimas tendencias y tecnologías emergentes en el campo.
Garantizar la calidad de los desarrollos, su finalización a tiempo y el cumplimiento de la función para la que fueron desarrollados. Tomando las acciones pertinentes cuando se den desviaciones.
Participar en las definiciones de los requerimientos del cliente orientándolo para generar el mínimo impacto sobre el software. 
Asegurar que la documentación y los controles de calidad se cumplan.
Participar en la definición de especificaciones técnicas para hacer desarrollos que cubran necesidades técnicas y de conectividad del Cliente
Preparar las pruebas técnicas, de integridad y el material de pruebas relacionado unitarias.
Participar en otras áreas de la empresa de ser requerido.
Reportar periódicamente los avances en las actividades asignadas y tomar los correctivos necesarios para asegurar el cumplimiento de su plan de trabajo.
 
Condiciones Laborales:
Lugar de Trabajo: Bogotá preferiblemente
Tipo de Contrato: A Término Indefinido.
Rango Salarial: Por favor indicar aspiración salarial
